buttons.long_description: Create a new virtual environment in a directory called 'venv' within the current folder. This will create a folder containing the Python interpreter and standard libraries.

This command sets up the environment variables so that the Python interpreter and packages are isolated to 'myenv'. You can run python files from anywhere and make use of the currently activated venv.
Similar to the above, but for Windows systems.
This will return you to the global Python environment or the previous one you were using.
It's a good practice to keep pip up-to-date inside your environment.
Recreate the environment with the same packages and versions as listed in 'requirements.txt'.
This completely removes the environment folder and all its contents.
